title: Nittany Lions roars past Hoosiers
text:
Nittany Lions roars past Hoosiers 
By WISE Web Sports Indiana University Hoosiers October 10, 2015 Updated Oct 10, 2015 at 10:40 PM EDT 
(State College, Pennsylvania) -- Penn State planned on facing a quarterback who'd make plays with his feet on Saturday. Instead, the Nittany Lions' own signal - caller burned Indiana with his legs and his arm, too. Christian Hackenberg threw for 262 yards, two touchdown passes and ran for two scores and Penn State beat the Hoosiers 29 - 7 at Beaver Stadium. Indiana was down to its third quarterback in the game. With Nate Sudfeld injured, backup Zander Diamont started, then was replaced by Danny Cameron after he got hurt. The Hoosiers fell to 4 - 2 for the season, 0 - 2 in the Big Ten.
